summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports indicating her employment with the committee. These reports list her name, salary, and employment dates. She appears in payroll certifications for April 1978, certification reports for August 1978, and December 1978.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, a body tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work.
